Activity: Arrive at work, settle in, and brew a cup of herbal tea (chamomile, perhaps?). Briefly check personal email and browse a favorite blog about mindfulness.
Log into the help desk system and check for any new EHR system issues or data collection problems reported over the weekend. Prioritize based on severity and impact.
Begin working on the highest priority ticket: A report from @RN-1 that patient data isn't syncing correctly between the bedside monitor and the EHR. Attempt to reproduce the error myself.

Troubleshoot the data syncing issue. Check network connectivity, verify the EHR system's event logs for errors related to the patient in question. Research known issues in our internal knowledge base.
If the syncing issue persists, document all troubleshooting steps taken, error messages encountered, and the specific patient information involved. Prepare a detailed summary to escalate.

Draft an email to @EHRDEV-1 and @ITPM-1, clearly explaining the data syncing problem, the steps taken to troubleshoot, and requesting their assistance in resolving the issue. Include relevant screenshots and log excerpts.
Switch to the next highest priority ticket: A request from @MRS-2 about difficulty accessing a specific archived record in the EHR. Verify their login credentials and access permissions.
Lunch Break. Spend some time reading a book of poetry in the breakroom.

Continue working on the @MRS-2 archived record issue. Research common causes for access issues (e.g., incorrect permissions, corrupted record, system glitch). Try to access the record myself to see if it's a system-wide problem.

If unable to resolve the access issue, document the steps taken and any error messages. Escalate the problem to @DBA-1 and @HIS-1 via email, describing the user's problem and the specifics of the record they are trying to access.
Check back on the original data syncing issue raised by @RN-1. Have @EHRDEV-1 or @ITPM-1 responded? If so, follow their instructions or provide additional information as requested.
Review all open help desk tickets and ensure they are properly categorized and prioritized. Add detailed notes to each ticket documenting all communication and troubleshooting steps.
Dedicate time to browsing through online articles related to mindfulness and exploring calming techniques.
Prepare a summary of the day's activities, including resolved issues, escalated problems, and pending tasks. Plan for tomorrow's work based on the current priorities.
